result.execSummary:
The defendant Mercedes Shaprece Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
All costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharge to be paid by the end of probation 6/23/2023 or to convert to a civil judgment.
-Court set restitution at zero.

No possession of firearms.
No contact with A.T.W. or D.D.J.

Absolute sobriety with random testing.
Attend firearms safety course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedes Shaprece Kelly

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mercedes Shaprece Kelly in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with Huber privileges for work credit for 1 day time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- no possession of firearms
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no contact with ATW or DDJ
- attend firearms safety course

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 6/23/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.  

Appeal rights given

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and offer letter, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Defendant Mercedes Shaprece Kelly in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court they are in receipt of discovery and offer and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-12-2022, filed.  rmm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mercedes Shaprece Kelly in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Mercedes Shaprece Kelly in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mercedes Shaprece Kelly appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
